title: CCR API Tests for Elastic Search
details: Testing new Elastic Search feature using chocolatey API calls
notes:
When calling the API the returned results may change depending on the order being used (not talking about the ordering itself), a similar thing happens on the production website, so mainly leaving it here so we are aware of it to look into in the future.
- When calling the command `choco list chocolatey --by-id-only --id-starts-with` the API will return 25 packages found.
- When calling the command `choco list chocolatey --by-id-only --id-starts-with --order-by-popularity` only 5 packages will be found.

If you search for `choco` it finds a number of results, with chocolatey being far down the list. If you search for `chocol` it finds a single result that appears to have a typo in the description.

- Another example is searching for `intune` and `intun` (today intun returns a single result and intune returns 0 results=.

If you mouse over a result and then hit enter, it will often take you to that result instead of searching what you typed in

- Example: type `adobe`, then mouse over `adobereader` and press `enter`. It will try to take you to the adobe reader package
- Initially I thought this was happening after mousing off of the entry, but it seems to happening only if you keep the mouse over the package in question.
Software source is not included in the API results when calling `choco info` (`choco info firefox used`)

Identifier returned in the API results do not contain the original case of the software (`choco info innosetup` for instance uses upper case `I` and `S` which shows up correctly on CCR Production, but not on the test instance. This needs to be tested to verify whether it causes problems during uninstalling a package: see https://github.com/chocolatey/choco/issues/1040 for details).

The verifier runs normally on a scheduled timer on each approved package after x amount of days, if this run changes the status of the package after it have been listed this change will not be reflected in the search results and on Chocolatey CLI results until the index have been manually re-indexed.

When searching for the package `git` the package bcc-msbuildlog is showing up, which do not have git as part of the identifier, the tag, or in the description. It however have the tag GitHub in that specific casing which probably splits the word based on the case. For tags we should probably not split it and only expect exact matches instead (found during a call to `choco search git –all-versions`). There are other packages incorrectly matching as well.

- [dotnet-script](https://community.chocolatey.org/packages/dotnet.script) - Uses a full url to the github tag instead of correctly tagging the package.
- [bcc-msbuildlog](https://community.chocolatey.org/packages/bcc-msbuildlog/0.1.9) - Uses GitHub as a tag, which incorrectly matches (probably due to splitting on case difference).
- [bcc-submission](https://community.chocolatey.org/packages/bcc-submission/0.1.3) - Uses GitHub as a tag as well
- [atom](https://community.chocolatey.org/packages/atom/1.51.0) - Uses GitHub as a tag, as well as GitHub Inc in the software authors (uncertain if the software author should have matched).
- And more (5606 matches was found, not going through all of them)...
Using the search term `id:firefox` on the website do not boost the exact identifier match to the top. Instead `firefox-nightly` is shown first. Removing `id:` shows the exact match first.

When calling the API the returned results may change depending on the order being used (not talking about the order changing itself, but the amount of results returned), a similar thing happens on the production website, so mainly leaving it here so we are aware of it to look into in the future.

- When calling the command `choco list --by-id-only --id-starts-with`` the API will return 25 packages found.
- When calling the command `choco list chocolatey --by-id-only --id-starts-with --order-by-popularity` only 5 packages will be found.

**Possible Enhancement**: If you try to combine search modifiers, it has unexpected results. (today the search modifiers tested don't exist)

- If you search for `intune author:microsoft` it will search for an author of `intune microsoft`.
- Similarly if you search for `tag:terminal wez` it searches for the tag `terminal wez`.

**Possible Enhancement**: If you search for `choco` the results that show up have several packages that contain an example of how to call Chocolatey using the package parameters. Considering this, it might be worth it to include a stop word for purely the description to ignore the word `choco` completely.

**Possible Enhancement**: If a package contains `[Deprecated]` in the title, a negative boost should probably be applied to make sure it is listed as low as possible. Or possibly just don't index such packages.

tests.name: Normal search for Firefox
tests.details: The differences in the log between production and the test instance is believed to be due to caching on the production site. All results on test instance seems to have firefox either in the id, tag or the description!

tests.name: Listing a single package with non-lowercase letters
tests.details: The new implementation of elastic search code causes the identifier to be a forced lowecase even if the package do not specify it as a lowercase. This could be fine in most cases, but there is a known bug that causes uninstalls to fail when the casing is not correct. This need to be verified that it is not causing an issue. See GitHub issue for more information: https://github.com/chocolatey/choco/issues/1040

logs.title: OSS Production
logs.content:
Chocolatey v0.12.1
InnoSetup 6.2.0 [Approved]
 Title: Inno Setup | Published: 03.06.2021
 Package approved as a trusted package on jun 03 2021 09:44:29.
 Package testing status: Passing on jun 03 2021 09:21:44.
 Number of Downloads: 395220 | Downloads for this version: 38780
 Package url
 Chocolatey Package Source: https://github.com/admiringworm/chocolatey-packages/tree/master/automatic/innosetup
 Package Checksum: 'T6sH70ktUQUlF4gNPqHODYzHj0MHFaxyrbzI4Dzfmm2ZFEglU7L+F44HNyby5SeCPqOrS5Nds9xkL/otZSNEIQ==' (SHA512)
 Tags: innosetup admin installer setup exe foss
 Software Site: http://www.jrsoftware.org/isinfo.php
 Software License: http://www.jrsoftware.org/files/is/license.txt
 Software Source: https://github.com/jrsoftware/issrc
 Documentation: http://www.jrsoftware.org/ishelp/
 Mailing List: http://www.jrsoftware.org/ismail.php
 Issues: https://github.com/jrsoftware/issrc/issues
 Summary: Inno Setup is a free installer for Windows programs. First introduced in 1997, Inno Setup today rivals and even surpasses many commercial installers in feature set and stability.
 Description: Inno Setup is a free installer for Windows programs. First introduced in 1997, Inno Setup today rivals and even surpasses many commercial installers in feature set and stability.
  
  ## Key features
  
  - Support for **every Windows release since 2000**, including: *Windows 10*, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008, Windows XP, Windows Server 2003, and Windows 2000. (No service packs are required.)
  - Extensive support for installation of **64-bit applications** on the 64-bit editions of Windows. Both the x64 and Itanium architectures are supported. (On the Itanium architecture, Service Pack 1 or later is required on Windows Server 2003 to install in 64-bit mode.)
  - Supports creation of a **single EXE** to install your program for easy online distribution. Disk spanning is also supported.
  - Standard Windows wizard interface.
  - **Customizable setup types**, e.g. Full, Minimal, Custom.
  - Complete **uninstall** capabilities.
  - Installation of files:
    Includes integrated support for "deflate", bzip2, and **7-Zip LZMA/LZMA2 file compression**. The installer has the ability to compare file version info, replace in-use files, use shared file counting,
    register DLL/OCX's and type libraries, and install fonts.
  - Creation of shortcuts anywhere, including in the Start Menu and on the desktop.
  - Creation of registry and .INI entries.
  - Running other programs before, during or after install.
  - Support for **multilingual** installs, including right-to-left language support.
  - Support for passworded and encrypted installs.
  - Support for **digitally signed** installs and uninstalls, including dual signing (SHA1 & SHA256).
  - Silent install and uninstall.
  - **Unicode** installs.
  - Integrated preprocessor option for advanced compile-time customization.
  - Integrated Pascal scripting engine option for advanced run-time install and uninstall customization.
  - Full *source code* is available (Borland Delphi 2.0-5.0 and 2009).
  
  **Is it really free of charge, even for commercial use?**
  Yes, it may be used completely free of charge, even when deploying commercial applications.
  However if you wish to show your appreciation and support its development you can make a [donation](http://www.jrsoftware.org/isdonate.php).
  *(Note: "Completely free of charge" must not be confused with "completely free". Inno Setup is copyrighted software, not public domain software. There are some restrictions on distribution and use; see the [LICENSE.TXT](http://www.jrsoftware.org/files/is/license.txt) file for details.)*
  
  ## Package Parameters
  
  - `/UseInf:` - Change the inno setup configuration file to use/save when installing
  
  **EXAMPLE**
  `choco install innosetup --params "'/UseInf:C:\innosetup.install.inf'"`
 Release Notes: [Software Changelog](http://www.jrsoftware.org/files/is6-whatsnew.htm)
  [Package Changelog](https://github.com/AdmiringWorm/chocolatey-packages/blob/master/automatic/innosetup/Changelog.md)

tests.name: Listing a single firefox package
tests.details: New implementation of elastic search causes the API to no longer return the software source URL, unlike on the production site.

logs.title: OSS Production
logs.content:
Chocolatey v0.12.1
Firefox 97.0 [Approved]
 Title: Mozilla Firefox | Published: 08.02.2022
 Package approved as a trusted package on feb 08 2022 20:16:37.
 Package testing status: Passing on feb 08 2022 18:44:35.
 Number of Downloads: 28353006 | Downloads for this version: 187304
 Package url
 Chocolatey Package Source: https://github.com/chocolatey-community/chocolatey-packages/tree/master/automatic/firefox
 Package Checksum: 'uNY04iFpgxXZ9A7ytZBOw7MH8cv5wTRNRwBFSuxP4hr2TCanHIOQg0OBYXxjtk6uVkpLuxpnvO5aST1eU9QDkw==' (SHA512)
 Tags: browser mozilla firefox admin foss cross-platform
 Software Site: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/new/
 Software License: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/
 Software Source: https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/
 Documentation: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox
 Issues: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/
 Summary: Bringing together all kinds of awesomeness to make browsing better for you
 Description: Bringing together all kinds of awesomeness to make browsing better for you.
  
  ## Features
  
  - A powerful, new engine that's built for rapidfire performance.
  - Better, faster page loading that uses less computer memory.
  - Gorgeous design and smart features for intelligent browsing.
  - Instantly import your online info and favorites from any other browser.
  - The most powerful private browsing mode with added tracking protection.
  - Firefox Quantum features: screenshots, pocket, gaming & VR, library.
  - Customization Features - addons & extensions, themes, toolbar.
  - Synced across devices - passwords, bookmarks, tabs and more.
  - Ad tracker blocking.
  - Password manager.
  
  ## Package Parameters
  
  - `/l:LOCALE` - Install given Firefox locale. See the [official page](https://releases.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/latest/README.txt) for a complete list of available locales.
  - `/UseMozillaFallback` Makes a request to mozilla.org and reads the supported Language Culture code from the website.
  
  Command-line options for installer configuration. See the [official page](https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/browser/installer/windows/installer/FullConfig.html) for details and defaults.
  
  - `/InstallDir:PATH`
  - `/NoTaskbarShortcut` Do not create Taskbar Shortcut
  - `/NoDesktopShortcut` Do not create Desktop Shortcut
  - `/NoStartMenuShortcut` Do not create Start Menu Shortcut
  - `/NoMaintenanceService` Do not install Maintenance Service
  - `/RemoveDistributionDir` Remove Distribution directory on installation/update. (This is the default behavior of the Firefox Installer, but not for this Chocolatey Package)
  - `/NoAutoUpdate` Sets a policies.json file to not update Firefox and does not install the Maintenance Service
  
  ### Examples
  
  `choco install Firefox --params "/l:en-GB"`  
  `choco install Firefox --params "/NoTaskbarShortcut /NoDesktopShortcut /NoAutoUpdate"`  
  `choco install Firefox --params "/l:en-GB /RemoveDistributionDir"`
  
  ## Notes
  
  - Looking for Firefox Developer Edition? Install the [firefox-dev](/packages/firefox-dev) package.
  - Looking for Firefox Extended Support Release? Install the [FirefoxESR](/packages/FirefoxESR) package.
  - If locale package parameter is not present, this package installs Firefox in the first language which matches this list:
    1. If Firefox is already installed it uses the same language as the already installed one.
    1. The Windows system language.
    1. Language Culture code specified on Mozilla website (only when `/UseMozillaFallback` is specified).
    1. If Firefox does not support the system language, it will fall back to `en-US`.
 Release Notes: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/97.0/releasenotes/

1 packages found.

 Summary: Bringing together all kinds of awesomeness to make browsing better for you
 Description: Bringing together all kinds of awesomeness to make browsing better for you.
  
  ## Features
  
  - A powerful, new engine that's built for rapidfire performance.
  - Better, faster page loading that uses less computer memory.
  - Gorgeous design and smart features for intelligent browsing.
  - Instantly import your online info and favorites from any other browser.
  - The most powerful private browsing mode with added tracking protection.
  - Firefox Quantum features: screenshots, pocket, gaming & VR, library.
  - Customization Features - addons & extensions, themes, toolbar.
  - Synced across devices - passwords, bookmarks, tabs and more.
  - Ad tracker blocking.
  - Password manager.
  
  ## Package Parameters
  
  - `/l:LOCALE` - Install given Firefox locale. See the [official page](https://releases.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/latest/README.txt) for a complete list of available locales.
  - `/UseMozillaFallback` Makes a request to mozilla.org and reads the supported Language Culture code from the website.
  
  Command-line options for installer configuration. See the [official page](https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/browser/installer/windows/installer/FullConfig.html) for details and defaults.
  
  - `/InstallDir:PATH`
  - `/NoTaskbarShortcut` Do not create Taskbar Shortcut
  - `/NoDesktopShortcut` Do not create Desktop Shortcut
  - `/NoStartMenuShortcut` Do not create Start Menu Shortcut
  - `/NoMaintenanceService` Do not install Maintenance Service
  - `/RemoveDistributionDir` Remove Distribution directory on installation/update. (This is the default behavior of the Firefox Installer, but not for this Chocolatey Package)
  - `/NoAutoUpdate` Sets a policies.json file to not update Firefox and does not install the Maintenance Service
  
  ### Examples
  
  `choco install Firefox --params "/l:en-GB"`  
  `choco install Firefox --params "/NoTaskbarShortcut /NoDesktopShortcut /NoAutoUpdate"`  
  `choco install Firefox --params "/l:en-GB /RemoveDistributionDir"`
  
  ## Notes
  
  - Looking for Firefox Developer Edition? Install the [firefox-dev](/packages/firefox-dev) package.
  - Looking for Firefox Extended Support Release? Install the [FirefoxESR](/packages/FirefoxESR) package.
  - If locale package parameter is not present, this package installs Firefox in the first language which matches this list:
    1. If Firefox is already installed it uses the same language as the already installed one.
    1. The Windows system language.
    1. Language Culture code specified on Mozilla website (only when `/UseMozillaFallback` is specified).
    1. If Firefox does not support the system language, it will fall back to `en-US`.
